Abstract:
A symptom of anthracnose was monitored on mango fruits in
orchards in Indramayu, Indonesia. The incidence and the severity of the
disease were recorded. Colletotrichum asianum were isolated from the
symptomatic fruits. Identification of the fungi was based on
morphological characteristic and multilocus phylogenetic analysis. Mango
cv. Manalagi was chosen to arrange a pathogenicity test. The isolates
caused rotting symptomp on the fruit. They were re-isolated from the
symptomatic fruits to fullfill KochÂ’s postulates. This study represents
the new record of mango anthracnose and the first proof of C. asianum
associated with mango anthracnose in Indonesia.
